column4: hello all: I have japanese text/typing support enabled on my ubuntu. in the upgrade installation process, I'm getting many messages about this. Please take a look at the pertinent output at http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/3037. What shoudl i do?
no
tht will just tell you more about the problem
so when should i run that command? and how should i fix this problem?
its not really a problem....u just need to import the keys which have been used to sign the software
you can just ignore the warning......no big deal reallly

glad to hear it's not a problem. what do you mean that i just have to import the keys? How do i import the keys to ALL The programs that are giving this warning? you said I can ignore it? What're the repercussions for ignoring it?

basically, the programs are signed by encryption keys so that you can be sure that the software is clean. Now, you need to import the keys (small text files) so that your computer can verify against the signature in the software
so you mean it's got nothing to do with having my locale set to Japan or Japanese or something?
so if u ignore, ur computer can't verify but goes ahead with the install, shouldn't be a problem since you are using ubuntu repositories
NO
you mean even people using only English language stuff on their computers have the warning , too?
yes, probably if they haven't imported the appropriate keys
pardon my ignorance. what do you mean by "keys"? passwords?
oh, i just re-read what you wrote.
no, not exactly passwords.......they contain information about HOW a file has been encrypted and hence how to decrypt it........basically they are sort of a digital signature
i think i krnow what you mean by "keys" now.
dooglus, did you import your keys?
dooglus, I'd like to get things as smooth as i can?
I normally just ignore the warning :p.......i just imported the jonathan ridell key, in order to install KDE beta
so you need keys if you want to install some programs?
certain programs won't let u install unless u import the keys.....but kde beta was the first one i came across
in that case, i want to do what it takes to fix this "keys" problem.
